\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Installation of the \textsf{ToolsForHomalg} Package}}\label{install}
\logpage{[ 2, 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X808C72EC7B094FC8}{}
{
  To install this package just extract the package's archive file to the \textsf{GAP} \texttt{pkg} directory.

 By default the \textsf{ToolsForHomalg} package is not automatically loaded by \textsf{GAP} when it is installed. You must load the package with \\
\\
 \texttt{LoadPackage}( "ToolsForHomalg" ); \\
\\
 before its functions become available.

 Please, send me an e-mail if you have any questions, remarks, suggestions,
etc. concerning this package. Also, I would be pleased to hear about
applications of this package. \\
\\
\\
 Mohamed Barakat  }

\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Blueprints}}\label{Chapter_ToDo-list_Section_Blueprints}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X849630B07F560FF5}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes (for IsList, IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X8627840881B04F30}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes({\mdseries\slshape indicator, objects, attributes})\index{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes@\texttt{ToDo}\-\texttt{List}\-\texttt{Entry}\-\texttt{To}\-\texttt{Maintain}\-\texttt{Equal}\-\texttt{Attributes}!for IsList, IsList, IsList}
\label{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes:for IsList, IsList, IsList}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a todo list entry 



 The first argument is the \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape indicator}}. It is a list of sources like in ToDoListEntry. Each entry \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape SP}} has to be a threetuple. First entry of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape SP}} has to an object, for which the second entry of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape SP}}, which has to be the name of an attribute, must become known. Once the
attribute is known to the object, it will be compared to the third entry of
the list. This can be a value, which is compared directly a function, which is
launched and its return value is compared, or a list, consisting of a function
and arguments, so the return value of the function with given arguments is
compared. If there is no third entry in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape SP}}, it is only looked up if the value is known. Once all entries in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape indicator}} are processed like this, and all returned true in the comparasion, a list of
ToDoListEntryForEqualAttributes is installed. They are installed for the two
entries of the list \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape objects}} which can either be the objects itself or a list containing a function and
arguments, which return value is used. For each entry in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape attributes}} such an entry is installed. Such an entry can be the name of an attribute, if
both objects in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape objects}} should share the value between attributes with the same name, or a list of two
names, if the attributes do not have the same name. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributes (for IsList, IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X83C3ABAA78446811}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributes({\mdseries\slshape indicator, objects, attributes})\index{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributes@\texttt{ToDo}\-\texttt{List}\-\texttt{Entry}\-\texttt{To}\-\texttt{Maintain}\-\texttt{Following}\-\texttt{Attributes}!for IsList, IsList, IsList}
\label{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributes:for IsList, IsList, IsList}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a todo list entry 



 This function creates a ToDoListEntry which can install several
ToDoListEntries. The first two arguments, \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape indicator}} and \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape objects}} except that there will be only ToDoListEntries installed between the two
objects in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape objects}}. Each entry in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape attributes}} can either be a string which means that the attribute with the given name will
be set from the first to the second object in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape objects}} once it is known. The third argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape attributes}} is a list of attributes that will be propagated by ToDoListEntries. Each entry \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape TP}} can either be a list consisting of a DescriptionOfImplication string and one
of the following or just one of the following lists: It can be a string, which
means that the Attribute with the given name will be propagated from the first
to the second object. It can be a list, consisting of two entries, where the
first entry is a list of sources like in ToDoListEntry and the second might be
a function which will be launched once the first part is fulfilled. It can
also be a threetuple which will serve as second to fourth argument of
ToDoListEntry. Or it can be a string, which will set the attribute named like
this of the first object to the one named in the second object }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntry (for IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X829D3C967A146C7B}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntry({\mdseries\slshape source, target{\textunderscore}list})\index{ToDoListEntry@\texttt{ToDoListEntry}!for IsList, IsList}
\label{ToDoListEntry:for IsList, IsList}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a todo list entry 



 This function allows to create more than one ToDoListEntry with identical list
of sources at one time. First argument is a list of sources like in the other
ToDoListEntry functions Second argument is a list of threetuples, which serve
as second to fourth argument of ToDoListEntry or a function, which serves as
second argument for ToDoListEntry or a tuple with a description string and one
of the above. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoList{\textunderscore}this{\textunderscore}object}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X84032B267EDC4FAC}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoList{\textunderscore}this{\textunderscore}object\index{ToDoListthisobject@\texttt{ToDo}\-\texttt{List{\textunderscore}this{\textunderscore}object}}
\label{ToDoListthisobject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (global variable)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }




 Represents the objects for which the blueprint is created in the arguments }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributesBlueprint (for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 5 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X87779438810212EE}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributesBlueprint({\mdseries\slshape filter, indicator, objects, attributes})\index{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributesBlueprint@\texttt{ToDo}\-\texttt{List}\-\texttt{Entry}\-\texttt{To}\-\texttt{Maintain}\-\texttt{Equal}\-\texttt{Attributes}\-\texttt{Blueprint}!for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList}
\label{ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributesBlueprint:for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 This function installs an immediate method which can install
ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes. First argument must be a filter, and
once the filter becomes true the ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributes is
installed with the second to fourth argument as first to third. In those
attributes, at any point, the variable
ToDoList{\textunderscore}this{\textunderscore}object can be used. When the
entry is installed This will be replaced with the object to which the filters
became known, i.e. the one which triggered the immediate method. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributesBlueprint (for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 6 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7FFB4C148359E579}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributesBlueprint({\mdseries\slshape arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4})\index{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributesBlueprint@\texttt{ToDo}\-\texttt{List}\-\texttt{Entry}\-\texttt{To}\-\texttt{Maintain}\-\texttt{Following}\-\texttt{Attributes}\-\texttt{Blueprint}!for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList}
\label{ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributesBlueprint:for IsObject, IsList, IsList, IsList}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 The same as ToDoListEntryToMaintainEqualAttributesBlueprint for
ToDoListEntryToMaintainFollowingAttributes }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryBlueprint (for IsObject, IsList, IsList)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 7 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7A7B0E87843AF435}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryBlueprint({\mdseries\slshape arg1, arg2, arg3})\index{ToDoListEntryBlueprint@\texttt{ToDoListEntryBlueprint}!for IsObject, IsList, IsList}

 }

 
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDo-list entries}}\label{Chapter_ToDo-list_Section_ToDo-list_entries}

\hyperdef{L}{X86137045808AF035}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{AddToToDoList (for IsToDoListEntry)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7EB7863D7F4DC75E}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{AddToToDoList({\mdseries\slshape E})\index{AddToToDoList@\texttt{AddToToDoList}!for IsToDoListEntry}
\label{AddToToDoList:for IsToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }




 Adds the ToDo-list entry \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape E}} to the ToDo-lists of it's source objects and creates a new one, if this is
needed. This function might be called with lists of entries }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{SourcePart (for IsToDoListEntry)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X876F23977AA5C19E}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{SourcePart({\mdseries\slshape entry})\index{SourcePart@\texttt{SourcePart}!for IsToDoListEntry}
\label{SourcePart:for IsToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list 



 Returns the a list of source parts of the ToDo-list entry \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape entry}}. This is a triple of an object, a name of a filter/attribute, and a value to
which the attribute has to be set to activate the entry }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{TargetPart (for IsToDoListEntry)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X86B9FC7A78FF9347}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{TargetPart({\mdseries\slshape entry})\index{TargetPart@\texttt{TargetPart}!for IsToDoListEntry}
\label{TargetPart:for IsToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list 



 Returns the target part of the ToDo-list entry \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape entry}}. This is a triple of an object, a name of a filter/attribute, and a value to
which the specific filter/attribute should be set. The third entry of the list
might also be a function to which return value the attribute is set. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ProcessAToDoListEntry (for IsToDoListEntry)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7F63A94D7B43B880}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ProcessAToDoListEntry({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{ProcessAToDoListEntry@\texttt{ProcessAToDoListEntry}!for IsToDoListEntry}
\label{ProcessAToDoListEntry:for IsToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a boolean 



 Processes a ToDo-list entry, i.e. sets the information given in TargetPart if
the definitions in SourcePart are fulfilled. Returns a function if the entry
could be processed, false if not, and fail if SourcePart or TargetPart weren't
availible anymore. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntry (for IsList, IsObject, IsString, IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 5 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7DF4A87E7E84F14F}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntry({\mdseries\slshape arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4})\index{ToDoListEntry@\texttt{ToDoListEntry}!for IsList, IsObject, IsString, IsObject}
\label{ToDoListEntry:for IsList, IsObject, IsString, IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a ToDoListEntry 



 The first argument must be a list consisting of two, three or four-tuples
where the first entry must be the object to which the attribute given as a
string in the second entry must be known to process this entry. The second
entry can also be a list of strings, in that case all the attributes given as
names must be known. Also, in this case, only two entries in this tuple are
allowed. The third part can be a value or a list, consisting of a function
followed by arguments which will be computed by the time the attribute given
as second entry becomes known to the first entry. If the second part is only a
string, and there is a third entry in the tuple the attribute is compared to
the third entry. One can set a comparating function as fourth entry, which
must take two entries and return false or true. If the value of the attribute
matches the (computed) value in the third entry for all members of the list in
the first argument the attribute given as third argument, also by name, of the
second argument is set to the value of the fourth argument. This can also be a
list which has to be computed, or a function, which retun value is used in
this case. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntry (for IsList, IsFunction)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 6 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7FAFD188845D6FA6}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntry({\mdseries\slshape arg1, arg2})\index{ToDoListEntry@\texttt{ToDoListEntry}!for IsList, IsFunction}
\label{ToDoListEntry:for IsList, IsFunction}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a ToDoListEntry 



 The first argument is a list of three-tubles like above. Once all
preconditions become fulfilled the function given as second argument is
launched. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{SetTargetValueObject (for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 7 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X8041DC118358A5CD}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{SetTargetValueObject({\mdseries\slshape entry, value})\index{SetTargetValueObject@\texttt{SetTargetValueObject}!for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject}
\label{SetTargetValueObject:for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 If the given value of the target part is the return value of a function this
command sets the target value of the entry to a function. This is done to keep
proof tracking availible. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{SetTargetObject (for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 8 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X793216E3836F177C}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{SetTargetObject({\mdseries\slshape entry, obj})\index{SetTargetObject@\texttt{SetTargetObject}!for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject}
\label{SetTargetObject:for IsToDoListEntry, IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 If the target object, i.e. the first entry of the target part, was given as a
function, this method can set this entry to the return value computed in
ProcessToDoListEntry. This happens atomatically, do not worry about it. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryWithContraposition (for IsObject, IsString, IsBool, IsObject, IsString, IsBool)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 9 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X804F847184D6908B}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryWithContraposition({\mdseries\slshape sobj, source{\textunderscore}prop, sval, tobj, target, tval})\index{ToDoListEntryWithContraposition@\texttt{ToDoListEntryWithContraposition}!for IsObject, IsString, IsBool, IsObject, IsString, IsBool}
\label{ToDoListEntryWithContraposition:for IsObject, IsString, IsBool, IsObject, IsString, IsBool}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a ToDoListEntry 



 Creates a ToDoListEntry which also installs a contraposition. The arguments \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape source{\textunderscore}prop}} and \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape target}} need to be strings which name a property, and \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape sval}} and \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape tval}} need to be boolean values, i.e. true or false. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{DescriptionOfImplication (for IsToDoListEntry)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 10 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X81E733C27D96F9C8}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{DescriptionOfImplication({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{DescriptionOfImplication@\texttt{DescriptionOfImplication}!for IsToDoListEntry}
\label{DescriptionOfImplication:for IsToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list 



 Has to be set to a string, which describes the reason for the conclusion. If
the ToDo-list entry is displayed, the given string will be displayed with a
because before it. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ToDoListEntryForEqualAttributes (for IsObject, IsString, IsObject, IsString)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 11 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X83F78A1D7DF72241}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ToDoListEntryForEqualAttributes({\mdseries\slshape arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4})\index{ToDoListEntryForEqualAttributes@\texttt{ToDoListEntryForEqualAttributes}!for IsObject, IsString, IsObject, IsString}

 a ToDoListEntry

\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{This is the magic}}\label{Chapter_ToDo-list_Section_This_is_the_magic}
\logpage{[ 3, 5, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7B69858A7C5DD48B}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Process{\textunderscore}A{\textunderscore}ToDo{\textunderscore}List{\textunderscore}Entry}}
\logpage{[ 3, 5, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X788F2635833587F8}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Process{\textunderscore}A{\textunderscore}ToDo{\textunderscore}List{\textunderscore}Entry({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{ProcessAToDoListEntry@\texttt{Process{\textunderscore}}\-\texttt{A{\textunderscore}}\-\texttt{To}\-\texttt{Do{\textunderscore}}\-\texttt{List{\textunderscore}}\-\texttt{Entry}}
\label{ProcessAToDoListEntry}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (function)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a boolean 



 Gets a ToDo-list entry, which is a pair of a list of strings and a weak
pointer object, and processes it. If the action was done, it returns true, if
not, it returns false, and it returns fail if the action is not possible
anymore due to deleted objects. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ProcessToDoList (for IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 5, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7AD403197873FE42}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ProcessToDoList({\mdseries\slshape A})\index{ProcessToDoList@\texttt{ProcessToDoList}!for IsObject}
\label{ProcessToDoList:for IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 This is the magic! This attribute is never set. Creating an ToDo-list entry
installs an ImmediateMethod for this attribute for the specific category of
the object to which ToDo-list is added, and the filter the entry contains. It
is then triggert if the filters become applicable, so the ToDo-list is
processed }

 }

\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Proof tracking}}\label{Chapter_ToDo-list_Section_Proof_tracking}
\logpage{[ 3, 7, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7AB979547B1614FD}{}
{
  This is a way to track proofs from ToDoLists. Not only for debugging, but also
for knowing how things work together. 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{TraceProof (for IsObject, IsString, IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 7, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X86E9744B84BB30D1}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{TraceProof({\mdseries\slshape obj, name, val})\index{TraceProof@\texttt{TraceProof}!for IsObject, IsString, IsObject}
\label{TraceProof:for IsObject, IsString, IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a tree 



 If the object \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape obj}} has the attribute \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape name}}, and its value is \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape val}}, and the knowledge has been obtained trough ToDoList-entries, this method
traces the way the property was set, and returns a tree which describes the
full way of how the attribute became known. }

 }

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{DeactivateToDoList (for )}}
\logpage{[ 3, 8, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7EA3FF9D7A1B647E}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{DeactivateToDoList({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{DeactivateToDoList@\texttt{DeactivateToDoList}!for }
\label{DeactivateToDoList:for }
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 This operation deactivates ToDoLists for all objects. Note that it is not
possible to activate ToDoList for a single object while they are not
activated. ToDoListEntries will yet be stored for all objects that can have
ToDoLists. All objects created while ToDoLists are deactivated have by default
no ToDoList. }

\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Trees}}\label{Chapter_Trees}
\logpage{[ 8, 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X82EAC5E57CAA5FC5}{}
{
  The trees are used in ToDoLists. They are a technical feature, and fairly
general, so they also can be used somewhere else. 
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Trees}}\label{Chapter_Trees_Section_Trees}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X82EAC5E57CAA5FC5}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{IsTree (for IsObject)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7ACE7DC5811BC3E6}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{IsTree({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{IsTree@\texttt{IsTree}!for IsObject}
\label{IsTree:for IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (filter)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 \texttt{true} or \texttt{false} 



 The category of trees. A tree may have a content, a list of successors, a
predecessor and it knows if it is a leave of a tree or not. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Content (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7F3BD31F8167E2AD}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Content({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{Content@\texttt{Content}!for IsTree}
\label{Content:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 object 



 The content of the tree. May be any object. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ListOfSuccessors (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X87364E1880BAFD86}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ListOfSuccessors({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{ListOfSuccessors@\texttt{ListOfSuccessors}!for IsTree}
\label{ListOfSuccessors:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list of trees 



 Returns the list of successors of a tree. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Predecessor (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7963601778389D55}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Predecessor({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{Predecessor@\texttt{Predecessor}!for IsTree}
\label{Predecessor:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a tree or fail 



 Returns the predecessor of a tree, or fail if there is none. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ListOfSentinels (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 5 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7DBFDC727BD18391}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ListOfSentinels({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{ListOfSentinels@\texttt{ListOfSentinels}!for IsTree}
\label{ListOfSentinels:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list 



 Returns a list of leaves of the tree. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{RemoveHead (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 6 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X82C8BE577AF4389D}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{RemoveHead({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{RemoveHead@\texttt{RemoveHead}!for IsTree}
\label{RemoveHead:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a tree 



 Returns the first successor of the tree, and adds all other successors of the
tree to the tree that is returned. If the tree is a leave, it returns an empty
tree. If the tree is empty, it returns the tree itself. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Tree (for )}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 7 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X8507B90983E191EF}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Tree({\mdseries\slshape arg})\index{Tree@\texttt{Tree}!for }
\label{Tree:for }
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a tree 



 Returns an empty tree. }

\logpage{[ 8, 1, 8 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X822ED357788C5AE8}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Tree({\mdseries\slshape obj})\index{Tree@\texttt{Tree}!for IsObject}
\label{Tree:for IsObject}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a tree 



 Returns a tree with argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape obj}}. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Add (for IsTree, IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 9 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7C9C3B5F81D1B816}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{Add({\mdseries\slshape tree, new{\textunderscore}tree})\index{Add@\texttt{Add}!for IsTree, IsTree}
\label{Add:for IsTree, IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 nothing 



 Adds the [list of] tree[s] \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape new{\textunderscore}tree}} as successor to the tree \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape tree}}. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{ContentListFromSentinelToHead (for IsTree)}}
\logpage{[ 8, 1, 10 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X874C552787D43D73}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\ \ \texttt{ContentListFromSentinelToHead({\mdseries\slshape sent})\index{ContentListFromSentinelToHead@\texttt{ContentListFromSentinelToHead}!for IsTree}
\label{ContentListFromSentinelToHead:for IsTree}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
 a list 



 Returns a list of the contents of the trees from the leave \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape sent}} up to the content of the head of the tree. }

 a list
